utilities module¶

utilities contains useful, non-physics functions used in DarkHistory.

utilities.arrays_equal(ndarray_list)¶

Check if the arrays contained in ndarray_list are equal.

Parameters:ndarray_list (sequence of ndarrays) – List of arrays to compare.
Returns:True if equal, False otherwise.
Return type:bool
utilities.compare_arr(ndarray_list)¶

Prints the arrays in a suitable format for comparison.

Parameters:ndarray_list (list of ndarray) – The list of 1D arrays to compare.
utilities.div_ignore_by_zero(a, b, val=0)¶

Divides a by b, returning val if a divide-by-zero error occurs.

Parameters:
  • a (ndarray) – Numerator of the division.
  • b (ndarray) – Denominator of the division.
  • val (float) – Value given as the result of the division if a divide-by-zero error occurs.
Returns:

The result of the division of the two arrays.
Return type:

ndarray
utilities.is_log_spaced(arr)¶

Checks if arr is a log-spaced array.

Parameters:arr (ndarray) – Array for checking.
Returns:True if equal, False otherwise.
Return type:bool
